bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Louis H. Bauer, November 19, 1952

div1.p: Hench suggests to Bauer that a representative of the American Medical Association place a wreath either beneath the medallion of Finlay at Camp Lazear or on Finlay's grave during the dedication ceremonies of Camp Lazear.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Louis H. Bauer, November 19, 1952
div1.opener:
November 19, 1952
Dr. Louis H. Bauer, President
American Medical Association
131 Fulton Avenue
Hempstead
Long Island, New York
My dear Doctor Bauer:
div1.p:
You may have heard from Dr. Austin Smith (to whom I wrote) or from other
sources, about the matter mentioned in the enclosed letter.

I think the Cuban Government is planning to invite a representative of
the American Medical Association to attend this affair but to whom they
are sending invitations, I do not exactly know. In any event, it seems
to me that it would be a splendid thing and would do much to improve
Cuban-American relationships, especially Cuban-American medical rela-
tionships, if a representative of the American Medical Association could
place an additional wreath either beneath the medallion of Finlay at
Camp Lazear, or on Finlay's grave on this occasion, or both.
May I ask your comments on this suggestion?
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
Enclosure
Copy sent to Dr. Austin Smith
